meanings.definition: The fact of having a right to something.
meanings.sent1: She felt a strong entitlement to the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The entitlement to a fair trial is a fundamental aspect of the justice system.
meanings.sent3: His entitlement to extra vacation days raised some eyebrows among his coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The entitlement to fresh air is often taken for granted until it is restricted.
meanings.sent5: The entitlement to education should be accessible to all children.

meanings.definition: The belief that one is inherently deserving of privileges or special treatment.
meanings.sent1: Her entitlement to preferential treatment made her unpopular among her peers.
meanings.sent2: The entitlement of the wealthy to tax breaks is a topic of debate.
meanings.sent3: His entitlement to always be first in line became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The entitlement of celebrities to privacy is constantly challenged by paparazzi.
meanings.sent5: The entitlement to respect should be earned through actions, not demanded.
